body: It's a scrollbar. Seems to be some Chrome-only issue because it works. Adding `overflow-y: clip` does seem to help for the scrollbar but does not fix the "g" cutoff, hmm. Maybe we should revert to `overflow: hidden` and set a proper line-height where necessary.

JS Fiddle: https://jsfiddle.net/6Ltbd581/16/

(ps: the `line-height: 1` comes from Fomantic UI's menu item)

Chrome:

<details>

![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/2114189/3f305cf6-72a8-461a-a8dc-d1de02ae737c)

</details>

`line-height: 1` is the root of the problem, I think at minimum `1.2` is recommended (roughly equivalnt to `normal`), but I would go for `1.4` to be safe as the right value depends on font in use and we get different fonts on different OSs.

The "more"root problem seems that Chrome doesn't consider "descent" into the line-height .... so characters like "g" / "y" causes layout problems .....

<details>

![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/2114189/1b1cee58-4665-4d8d-a4fd-bcaa7f34b991)

</details>

issue.body:
Fix #26537

Use the same default line-height as "normalize.css" instead of "1". "1" is not right because it doesn't work with descent part and causes overflow problems.

![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/2114189/3f2e8fb5-b326-4889-bfff-c79c75f1b7f4)

body:
@wxiaoguang  @silverwind 
It seems that this is not completely fixed, I can still see these green things.

in try.gitea.io
![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/18380374/2b67ea09-4787-4366-b1a8-870b0d2a1389)

in local
![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/18380374/4ee73c20-4cf5-41a8-80c0-9821b52d333e)
local version:
![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/18380374/f01a0c44-32dd-420a-879c-96af09ed9f83)

Ah, I see. this green thing is a scrollbar. ðŸ˜„ 

(removed overflow-x)
![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/18380374/ca957030-9103-4015-b532-03f1876cc565)

![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/18380374/dd53091c-6a63-4b6c-9367-ddfbaf0c9980)
![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/18380374/aa9b859e-7999-408e-b6e2-149ad810b8ce)

when --line-height-default is 1.20, it will disappear

the lowest value is 1.18
![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/18380374/cfffc3c3-d33c-4cec-9655-4099b32bacbb)
![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/18380374/e7b2b827-a8c3-4807-9755-cf709b26cff9)
Then the "modules/normalize.css" should also be changed accordingly

Does --line-height related to screen resolution?
My display is 1920 x 1080.
No, `line-height` only depends on the font's intrinsic height.

issue.body:
Fix #26537 again because 1.15 is too small for some fonts.
 
I do not see how the "padding-top/padding-bottom" affects the UI, and I do not think the pixel-level fine-tuning is a stable approach, so remove these fine-tunes.
